sentence.idiomatic: I knitted this hat myself.
I want to knit a pair of gloves to give to him.
What pattern do you want to knit?
Lately she is really into knitting.
This book has a lot of knitting patterns and techniques in it.
When in school, everyone weaves dreams in their hearts.
You are really amazing. You can even knit a sweater.
He is so amazing--he can speak six languages.
She is more amazing than we are--she's so young yet became a boss.
This one is not the same as that one. This one is more difficult.
The things at this shop are more expensive.
I still think that this red shirt looks nicer.
He is from Beijing, but he hasn't even been to the Great Wall.
I was so busy yesterday, I didn't even eat.
How can you not even drink beer?
Knitting a sweater is so enjoyable. I want to learn too.
It's more interesting to become a tour guide--you can travel all over the place.
Learning Chinese is really interesting. I want to study every day.
AuntySue, your scarf is really nice, where did you buy it?
I knitted it myself.
Really? That's really amazing!
Hey, scarves are the easiest to knit. Sweaters are more difficult.
I can't even knit a scarf.
Would you like to learn? I can teach you. Knitting is really enjoyable.
Sure, where do I buy the needles and the yarn?
I'll give you some.
I'd feel bad.
It's nothing, I have a lot.
